title: 107_s528
content: The "Safeguard the Vote Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes provisions for mail registration. The "Safeguard the Vote Act" requires first-time voters to present identification and mandates the removal of voters in response to undelivered notices. The "Safeguard the Vote Act" mandates safeguards to prevent voter removal and includes amendments to voter registration forms. The "Safeguard the Vote Act" mandates safeguards to prevent voter removal and includes amendments to voter registration forms. Section 3 focuses on the maintenance of an accurate list of eligible voters. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to include a required voter removal program to eliminate ineligible voters from official lists in jurisdictions where the number of eligible voters is less than the official list. Identification requirements are also added to ensure accuracy in voter registration. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to include identification requirements for voter affirmations and expedited access to felony conviction records for voter eligibility determination. Additionally, a penalty for conspiracy related to voter registration is amended. The National Voter Registration Act of 1993 is amended to include identification requirements for voter affirmations and expedited access to felony conviction records for voter eligibility determination. A penalty for conspiracy related to voter registration is also amended by inserting specific language in subparagraphs. SEC. 4 of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 is amended to increase penalties to $30,000. Misrepresentation of eligibility now includes false information about convicted felon status. SEC. 5 introduces a Voter Roll Coordination Demonstration Project. The Federal Election Commission will establish a demonstration project to determine the feasibility of coordinating the official list of registered voters with State records to ensure accuracy and prevent eligible voters from being improperly removed. The project will require States to maintain accurate records of eligible voters in the project area by coordinating with State motor vehicle authorities. The Federal Election Commission will conduct a study on voting jurisdictions' practices to maintain accurate voter lists and prevent fraud. The study will be part of a demonstration project under the National Voter Registration Act of 1993. The Federal Election Commission will implement a project in St. Louis County and City, Missouri, lasting until the next general election. A report will be submitted to Congress with recommendations on resources, technology, personnel, and legislative actions.
